contents:
Where America Comes to Play!

Wednesday, July 5 - Sunday, July 9, 2017

Complete Schedule

Updated 7/4/17 at 11:15PM EDT; All Event Reservations are up to date.

NOTE: Due to unforeseen circumstances, we are using the internal table grids instead of the usual master grids you are used to. We apologize for the inconvenience. These will also be printed in the onsite Program Book.

Wednesday Table Grid in PDF Format
Thursday Table Grid in PDF Format
Friday Table Grid in PDF Format
Saturday Table Grid in PDF Format
Sunday Table Grid in PDF Format

Click here for the MASTER INDEX OF EVENTS

You may ONLY reserve seats in DEXCON 20 events if you are pre-registered.
Click here to pre-register for DEXCON 20 if you have not already done so.

To reserve your spot in the events you want to play in, send eMail to: dexcon20@dexposure.com and include your name and the events you want to register for BY CODE ONLY! NOTE: You may ONLY choose Event Codes which are SHOWN IN GREEN. DO NOT CHOOSE CODES WHICH ARE SHOWN IN RED and have LOCKS on them. Red Event Codes indicate locked events which you cannot register for, later rounds in tournaments which you will be automatically advanced to from preliminary rounds, or events which have already filled up to capacity (this page will be updated several times before the convention starts).

NOTE: The CUTOFF for reserving events is 10:00AM EST on Wednesday, July 5. After that time, you can ONLY reserve events by physically entering your name on the Big Board when you arrive at the convention.

We allow you to select second and third choices for a given time slot; indicate this clearly in whatever fashion you'd like, otherwise we will just leave that slot open.

We will reply to your email with a confirmation that your reservations were received as quickly as possible. Note that you MUST include a valid eMail reply-to address for us to reach you to confirm. If you have previously selected LARPs and/or Signature Events, they will be included in this confirmation.

The Event Listing contains vital information about each event, in the format shown below:

Event ID; Type of Event; Event Name; Event Author. Event Description. Event Day & Time; Round (1); Materials (2). Level (3); Attitude (4), Age Notification (5). Next Round (6) (if applicable); See Also: Repetition of event or round (if applicable).

In the interest of conserving space, repeat listings of the same event or multiple round events will contain only the title, a reference to the first listing, time and round information. Note that prizes are usually NOT listed; all prizes will be gallery level certificates (or applicable awards), unless otherwise specified. In the case of cash prizes, Double Exposure reserves the right to withdraw the grand prize based on attendance of the specific event. Some cash value prizes will be awarded as certificates or shopping sprees for the Dealers' Room, and MAY be transferred to future Double Exposure conventions.

Notes:

(1) One Session; One round; 1 of x = First round, etc.; 1A of x = Same round repeated elsewhere.

(2) All Materials Provided (except dice); All Materials Offered (except dice), but feel free to bring your own; Bring Your Own Materials (and characters, if applicable).

(3) Beginners ONLY; Beginners Welcome; Knowledge of rules Necessary; Experts ONLY.

(4) Very Silly; Silly; Fun; Serious; Very Serious.

(5) All Ages; Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance; 18 & Over ONLY; Young Players Encouraged.

(6) All "Next Round" listings show which specific round or session you will be scheduled for automatically if you advance. This information is vital, and you should be aware of it, although you CAN reserve an alternate selection which takes place at the same time as a future advancement round. At the appropriate time, you will cancel one or the other. Note that all available events are shown in GREEN, and all advancement rounds are shown in RED.

All Special Headline Events are shown in YELLOW.

Q0001: "Breach! 2: A Flarrowverse LARP" by Sacred Grounds Gaming, Inc.. This isn't your typical day at the office. When people say they've been dealt a healthy dose of reality, they probably never realized that a pocket dimension to serve it up to them. Here on "The Beach House", you can party the night away and forget your troubles, or completely immerse yourself in the problems of others. Here, the Suicide Squad is on the loose, ARGUS is getting antsy, and STAR Labs is frantic and searching for answers. Another world just faced crisis and fell, and you just watched it happen. Maybe you're a survivor from a dead world. Maybe you left a great life behind for a higher calling. Either way, you're tending to the multiverse, man, and that ain't easy. Sacred Grounds Gaming presents Breach! 2 - A fan LARP set in the Berlanti/Kresiberg DC television universe (with some liberties taken with the canon). This year, we will be introducing a quicker combat system and a more player-centric character creation system. You can play a character from last year, or come in with a completely new one. Scientists, Refugees, Engineers, Soldiers, and Meta concepts are all welcome. Following our successes using RFID technology last year, we intend to continue to play with interactive electronics to enhance the gaming experience. Contact flarrowverselarp@gmail.com to work with us to discuss your concept or to inform us you will be returning from last year (please give us your name and who you played last year), or let us know of your intent to play a completely premade character. Characters can also be created at event L0006: The LARP Bazaar (Wednesday Night at 10:00PM). Costumes and props are highly encouraged, and required to play metahumans! Thursday, 8:00PM - 2:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, 18 & Over ONLY.

Q0002: Battlestar Galactica; "Tales of the Rising Star: Roll the Hard Six" by Phoenix Outlaw Productions & Eleventh Hour Productions. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! It's been a long ride for the passengers and crew of the Rising Star since the destruction of the Twelve Colonies. Disaster after disaster has plagued the converted medical ship as it has ferried its precious human survivors away from disaster. But now the discovery of a Cylon on board and the uncovering of a mysterious set of coordinates is leading the ailing ship to life altering changes for everyone on board. For at the end of the next jump lies a planet that may hold their salvation...or total destruction. Welcome to the final installment of Tales of the Rising Star as it reaches its conclusion and join up to 75 players as they take on the roles of colonial survivors and military in the Battlestar Galactica universe and face the Cylon threat in this highly freeform game. What you see is what you get - interact with computers, engines, and science problems hands on. Players should have a fair knowledge of the (modern) BSG television series and come with previous LARP experience. Players from previous Double Exposure events can continue playing their characters, but new character creation can be done before game either by emailing the game designers at BSGRisingStar@gmail.com and join the conversation with our game community here on Facebook. While props will be provided by the staff, costumes are highly encouraged! Friday, 7:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, 18 & Over ONLY.

Q0003: Bright Story; "Reclamation" by Phoenix Outlaw Productions. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! A bastion of love and truth has fallen to the forces of evil. It's up to you and your friends to resolve the trauma that doomed this fortress and retake it in the name of the Bright. Bright Story is a live action role playing game with optional live combat elements, inspired by animated media like Steven Universe, Adventure Time, and Gravity Falls. You'll level up by making friends and restore your abilities through self-care. Bright Story will have some movement and involve the use of contact-safe weapons to simulate combat. Please consider these aspects before deciding to attend. Email Josh Harrison at jharr421@gmail.com with questions, or search Bright Story LARP on Facebook to find our group. You can bring your own costuming and contact-safe weapons, use some of our loaners, or use only the power of your imagination. Write or visit our group to talk character creation, or pick up a pre-generated character at the event to get started. Saturday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

Q0004: Utopia Descending; "Welcome to the Party at the Edge of the World VII" by Imagine Nation. Utopia Descending is a science-fiction fantasy world that is part of an ongoing shared story collaboration between a number of networked chapters. The events of this Utopia Descending event are a part of our continuity, where You-Star potentials from around the world are coming to a massive social event that takes place whenever there is a very viable threat of epic scale. Utopia Descending uses three zones of engagement. The first Zone uses an American Freeform LARP area for those players just looking to role play in the focuses of socializing, political intrigue, and political manipulation. A secondary zone uses toyetic design for crafting, hands on science and research focused puzzles, as well as digital interaction. Lastly, there are locked combat zones which use a contact-safe combat system outlined on the Utopia Descending web page. The combat area will be a low light and intermittent light area. Our primary RP area will have music and neon lights, but the music will be kept to a lower volume to encourage social engagement and the lights will be solid state bright color LEDs. Players will be encouraged to set up character FB Pages as Fictional Characters so that they can live broadcast from their phones directly to their character FB pages. Remember: Higher ratings means more money for your IC company (and more perks for your character). Check out more about the world on www.utopiadescending.com or this event specifically at www.imaginenationcollective.com. Saturday, 8:00PM - 2:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, 18 & Over ONLY.

Q0005: The $500 David Stern Memorial Summer Poker Championship. Double Exposure's traditional Poker tournament. Played as No Limit Texas Hold 'Em, tables will be pared down as necessary. The grand prize is a $500 Gift Certificate for the DEXCON 20 Dealers' Room! Numerous small prizes will be awarded throughout the night, including a Bad Beat bonus prize of a 10-Point Prize Certificate, and a Royal Flush JACKPOT! NOTE: THERE IS NO GAMBLING AT DEXCON 20; ALL TRANSACTIONS ARE IN CHIPS WITH NO VALUE OUTSIDE OF THE GAME. Saturday, 12:00AM - 4:00AM; One Session; All Materials Provided. Knowledge Necessary; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0006: The DEXCON 20 LARP Bazaar. DEXCON is proud to present a showcase of LARPs which will be occurring during the convention. Don't know which ones to play in? Come and talk to the GMs of most of the over 40 LARPs which will be taking place during the next four days, and sit down with any of them for character creation and general shmoozing. Even if you are already signed up for some LARPs, come to the Bazaar and learn about all of the others! You didn't expect to sleep during DEXCON, did you? Wednesday, 10:00PM - 2:00AM; One Session; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0007: "Monster Break Room: Don't Steal Beholder's Bagel" presented by Eliana Schulman. What are the monsters like when they aren't fighting the heroes? Welcome to the monster break room. Don't worry, we only hate adventurers. Except the mind flayer, he really doesn't like to be interrupted when he's knitting. Doesn't matter what type of monster you are, even if you're from one of those weird future dimensions- you're welcome to take a load off your tentacles, put down your weapons, and join us to dish dirt on the adventurers you've faced. Note: This LARP is purely role playing. Thursday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Silly, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance. THIS EVENT HAS BEEN FILLED! You may sign up as an Alternate at the convention.

L0008: The Nexus; "Push the Button, Zap!" by Double Exposure, Inc.. A Nexus Gathering of Avatars for definitely NOT blowing up things. No! Really! Thursday, 11:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0009: "Escaping Steam" presented by Andi Gastonguay. Deep in Mount Hill lives the terrible dragon, Steam. Steam is trying to ruin everything so no one can have an awesome day. Many have traveled through the caverns of the mountain, but all have returned empty handed and sad. The townspeople of Downhill are afraid of living so close to such a mean creature, but are running out of ideas. They have asked your group of young super heroes to tackle the Steam problem, as knights and adventurers have not been successful. Join other super heroes and their trusty teddy bears* on an interactive exploration through Steam’s mountain to hopefully quell the dragon’s rage. *Parents are required to attend the game and will be playing the part of each child’s trusty teddy bear. This game is intended for ages 5 - 10. Thursday, 2:00PM - 4:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Young Players Encouraged.

L0010: Freeform; "Duck and Cover" by Damocles Thread Development. "Attention, prom committee of Woodrow Wilson High School: This is a nuclear attack drill. Do not panic. This is a drill. When the immediate danger has passed the sirens will sound a steady note. The 'all clear' message will also be given on the PA system. We will be on the air every hour, on the hour, until the drill has ended. That is the end of this broadcast. This is just a drill." Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0011: New World Magischola; "A Wolf By Any Other Name" by Learn Larp, LLC. You're away at magic school, you've gotten in trouble, and you've landed in detention. As if that wasn't bad enough, some of your fellow wizardly delinquents are probably werewolves. So you're trapped in the detention hall with dangerous, hidden monsters - and the full moon rises in one hour. Good thing you've got all that magic, isn't it? Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY. See Also: L0021, L0048.

L0012: The Adventures of Dr. Dolotts; "Powerless Heroes and Villains Group Grievance Theory" by Kitsune Entertainment. Therapist to Superheroes and Supervillains alike, Dr. Dolotts, is back. This time he's holding group therapy for both superheroes and supervillains who've lost their superpowers. With his own unique style, he will help these former heroes and villains get over what they've lost in themselves. Note: This LARP is purely role playing and has no combat. Players will create a character and then role play as that character in a group therapy-type of environment. Thursday, 2:00PM - 4:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0013: The Adventures of Dr. Dolotts; "Powerless Heroes and Villains Marriage Counseling" by Kitsune Entertainment. Therapist to Superheroes and Supervillains alike, Dr. Dolotts, is back. This time he's holding group therapy for both superheroes who are married to supervillains and supervillains who are married to superheroes. With a style all his own, he will help these superbeings through the ups and downs of married life. Players do NOT need to be in pairs. Note: This LARP is purely role playing and has no combat. Players will create a character and then role play as that character in a group therapy-type of environment. Thursday, 4:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0014: "LARP Character Essentials" presented by Andi Gastonguay. Join a trained and experienced improvisation actress to learn tips to take your LARP characters to the next level. Using methods from the world of improv you will leave the seminar with an arsenal of tricks to make each of your characters unique people. Come prepared to move and use your voice as we will be putting the various methods to the test. Thursday, 6:00PM - 8:00PM; One Session; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, All Ages.

L0015: CHRONOS; "The Shadow" by Eschaton Media; presented by Eleventh Hour Productions. An Envoy Event! People expelled from Neverland often have problems adjusting to the real world. They are the homeless, the refugees, and the dispossessed. A group of Normies have taken in the Iron Hook and Lost Boys in a local halfway house. They seek to give shelter and to understand the crazy things that seem to be happening around town. For weeks it has been a rewarding and fun filled place, but recently a sense of unease has been skulking around the outskirt. It is a thing of terrible, ravenous hunger that seeks to ensnare those who would succumb to its cunning. Come enter the twisted world of Peter Pan in Never Again. We are a Chronos based system that lends for anyone to come play and learn the rules quickly. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0016: Cthulhu Live! 3.5; "You Bet Your Life" by PST Productions. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! The Game, a traveling venue that only appears once every 72 years has returned. This year it has traveled to America, the year 1929 at the height of the Prohibition Era. Unlike your typical speakeasy casino, this game has much higher risks and rewards. If your luck holds out, you will walk away with a prize worth more than gold. However, if your luck fails you, the cost will be dear. "You Bet Your Life" is a classic era Cthulhu Live! adventure set in Philadelphia during the Prohibition. It takes place at an illegal speakeasy. Players will be from all walks of life from politicians to made men. Costumes are encouraged. This is a DEXCON 20 exclusive event to pay homage our very first game run at DEXCON so many years ago. For character pre-assignment and information contact us at pstproductions@gmail.com. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0017: Freeform; "The Porch" by Damocles Thread Development. Teenagers gather together on a porch in a small town, on the last night of the summer before they all go off to college or the army or another day at the corner deli. Each one of them has a burning question they want answered - but they can't quite bring themselves to ask. "The Porch" won a Golden Cobra award for Most Convention-Ready LARP at METATOPIA 2016. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance. THIS EVENT HAS BEEN FILLED! You may sign up as an Alternate at the convention.

L0018: Freeform; "Valkyrie Girlfriend" by Damocles Thread Development. We all know Valkyries collect the souls of the dead. But what happens if you don't die, and it turns out that the Valkyrie and you like each other? A spontaneous romantic LARP that runs throughout the convention. Allows players to explore different communication and relationship styles in a low-consequence environment. Submitted to the 2017 200 Word RPG Competition. Thursday, 12:00AM - 2:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Silly, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0019: "Goats 'n' Scapes" presented by Sarah McGill. GoatCam is a charitable organization, which puts cameras on goats. Its donors are philanthropists and animal lovers, who pay a lot of money to see what those goats are up to. They gather tonight on the Infinite Jest, a luxury cruise liner somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean. It is 2015, the Year of the Goat (or was it the Sheep?) and more funds must be raised for those poor animals. Rare curiosities and exotics will be auctioned to the highest bidder. The ruthless social elite and corrupt power brokers will wheel and deal. The glamorous will betray the notorious. And maybe there will be one or two people who just like goats. This is a parlor LARP; players will be given a character sheet with background, objectives, and relationships. The game is similar to a murder mystery, with a focus on interpersonal relationships and a variety of overlapping subplots. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0020: Akashic System; "Star Wars: A Wound in the Force" by Damocles Thread Development. The Force itself is screaming as the Mandalorian wars burn their way across the galaxy. World after world falls to chaos, strife, and desolation but still the Jedi Council does nothing. While the galaxy falls into anarchy one school of Jedi are beginning to question the wisdom of their masters, and a confluence of events has the brought the portents of war right to their doorstep. Come play as members of a Jedi Academy, fighting for what you believe in while dealing with the problems that come with being a budding defender of balance in a war-torn age. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0021: New World Magischola; "A Wolf By Any Other Name" by Learn Larp, LLC. See L0011. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round. See Also: L0048.

L0022: The Nexus; "Push the Button, Zap!" by Double Exposure, Inc.. A Nexus Gathering of Avatars for definitely NOT blowing up things. No! Really! Friday, 11:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0023: "Fort Builder/Capture the Flag" presented by Robert Dixon. Choose your team, build your fort, and capture the flag! Players will have a set period of time to build their base with materials provided (boxes, duct tape, PVC, etc.) and then will have to defend their base from enemy attack while stealing the enemy flag, and also reacting to surprise events happening during the rounds. Played with combat safe boffer weapons and Nerf Weaponry. A stupid, fun game, not meant to be taken seriously. Friday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners ONLY; Silly, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0024: "World of Warcraft: The Shadow Over Darkmoon" presented by Terra Chirieleison. Missing: Silas Darkmoon, and no one knows where he's gone. How could this have happened? Who could have done it? Can Alliance and Horde put their differences aside long enough to prevent the possible End of All Azorath? Role play and cooperative storytelling emphasized! Friday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0025: Freeform; "Black Sunday 1935" by Damocles Thread Development. A carnival has to ride out the Black Sunday storm of '35 in the church basement of a town that both hates and loves them. An American freeform based on southern gothic classics like "A Good Man Is Hard To Find" and "Carnivale". Friday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0026: Verdant Wastes; "The Beginning of the End is the Beginning, Part 2" presented by Gina Carosella. After narrowly escaping the oppressive regime of the Martian city of Syrtis Major, the rebels find themselves on a new world. Before they're able to collect themselves, they're greeted by those they thought extinct - humans. Will the Humans and Martians be able to sort out their differences before something worse comes along? Play as either the half-animal half-??? Martians or the recently resurfaced Humans as they work together to defend themselves against an unfathomable threat! It is not necessary to have played the first part of this module (at DREAMATION 2017), as everyone will be filled in on necessary information right in the beginning of the encounter. Friday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0027: Cthulhu Live! 3.5; "Dear Old Miskatonic" by PST Productions. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! Far above Miskatonic's waters, With its waves of green, Stands our noble Alma Mater, Glorious to be seen. Lift the chorus, speed it onward, All in such euphoric; Hail to thee, our Alma Mater! Hail, all hail, Miskatonic! Miskatonic is proud to announce the Summer of 1955 program: For the first time ever, a limited number of women will be allowed to apply for full matriculation or as Faculty at the university. With the help of the four Fraternal Orders on campus; female applicants will have the chance to establish their Sororities, and show off their skills for consideration by Admissions Staff and Dean of Students. The university implores women of academic talent to apply for a chance to participate in the summer program, and seeks volunteers from the current student body to act as campus ambassadors.The program kicks off in July with a semi-formal Open House; with chaperones and parents invited to attend. There will be opportunities to tour the campus and meet some of the faculty and staff. Guests will receive accommodations in the university dormitories. Please RSVP as soon as possible to reserve a space in this exciting new program of the new age for Dear Old Miskatonic! Ex ignorantia ad sapienti am; e luce ad tenebras! Costuming (1950s Semi-Formal) is strongly encouraged but not required. All Props will be provided. Trigger Warnings: Some characters written may be Male or Female Chauvinist. Please express trigger concerns when pre-registering by sending character requests to MissEmilyCaroline@gmail.com. Friday, 7:00PM - 11:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0028: Knight Realms; "The Gate's Rest Tavern". Welcome to the Gate's Rest Tavern in Altrion, your last stop before crossing the Great Rift into Travance! Here you will find a strange assortment of travelers and adventurers on their way to glory and fortune, or sometimes something more sinister. Come in and have a drink, there's always something interesting happening! Friday, 7:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, All Ages.

L0029: Legend of the Five Rings LARP; "The Next Emperor of Rokugon" presented by Grace Lyttle. The Empress Iweko I has died. Representatives from each clan have been summoned to the Imperial Court to name one of her twin sons the next Emperor. But would a warrior empress real commit seppuku so she would not die of an unclean illness, or is there a reason she was stabbed to death? Maybe deciding the next Emperor will not be so easy. This is a court intrigue LARP set within the world of the Legend of the Five Rings. Think feudal Japan with magic. As always, new players are welcome. We will have PreGens, but you are welcome to bring your own charachter. Please note if you do want to bring your own character, we are using the 4th Edition RPG rulebook. Core book ONLY, no minor clans or ronin permitted for this particular LARP. Friday, 7:00PM - 11:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, All Ages.

L0030: Vampire: The Masquerade; "Dark Ages: Vying for the Crown" by Kitsune Entertainment. The Prince of London must vacate their position. Now those in a position of power are making their bid for Prince known to the entire Domain. Which Clan will rise to the top in this, the ultimate grab for power? Players may contact us to build their own characters (subject to certain character creation rules), or they may take a character at the door. Friday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Knowledge Necessary; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0031: Vampire: The Masquerade; "Victorian Age: The Peace Accords" by Kitsune Entertainment. The Prince of London has made an unprecedented move: Invite the Sabbat to an Elysium to try and heal the rift between the Camarilla and the Sabbat. Is peace possible, or will the Kindred on both sides resist? Players may contact us to build their own characters (subject to certain character creation rules), or they may take a character at the door. Friday, 12:00AM - 4:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Knowledge Necessary; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0032: "Coruscant Burns: An Old Republic Story" by Three Raccoon Productions. After 28 years of total war, the Great Galactic War comes to its final stage thanks to a massive sneak attack by the Sith Empire on the Republic capital world of Coruscant. With the city planet in flames and the Jedi Temple in ruins, an emergency summit has been called on the conflicted world of Alderaan. With the loyalties of Alderaan’s noble houses split between the Republic and the Empire, a draft treaty to end the war is being negotiated to end the bloodshed on Coruscant and bring the Great Galactic War to a close. Extremist factions and criminal syndicates will stop at nothing to prevent the treaty from being signed while the Republic needs this treaty to save millions and the Sith require this treaty because the Emperor has commanded it. Character creation and rules training will be available prior to the game. Costuming is encouraged. All communication can be sent to: threeraccoonproductions@gmail.com. Saturday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0033: "No Planet for Old Pirates" presented by Sarah McGill. In a future where Earth has been forgotten, a small crew of pirates struggles to keep flying on the edge of known space. They are a cutthroat band of vultures and opportunists. Some want a promotion by any means necessary. Others want to get rich and get out. The captain just wants to keep them all in line. And half the galaxy wants the whole lot dead. An interstellar war is about to launch between a fading empire and one upstart planet. Captain Huckabee Capone and the crew of the Tender Loving Care race to take a stand with the rebels.These pirates will have to sort out their differences or be torn apart in the crossfire. This is a parlor LARP; players will be given a character sheet with background, objectives, and relationships. The game is similar to a murder mystery, with a focus on interpersonal relationships and a variety of overlapping subplots. Saturday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0034: Clue, the LARP; "In the Cold of the Night" by Kitsune Entertainment. At the South Pole is the Boddy Institute's Antarctic research station. Things are going as they should when a violent explosion rocks the station. Now the inhabitants are trapped in the various rooms of the station with no chance of rescue. Can they get the facility back up and running before the unforgiving environment claims their lives? Only time will tell. The classic characters of Clue come together in another scenario where murder is the order of the day. Saturday, 9:00AM - 11:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0035: Clue, the LARP; "I'm Not Saying It's Aliens..." by Kitsune Entertainment. The Agency has rounded up a number of unlisted beings from outside this solar system who are on Earth, but aren't supposed to be on Earth, and put them into holding for review to determine the threat level they possess to the people of Earth. What will the Agency determine? The classic characters of Clue come together in a brand new scenario where murder is the order of the day. Saturday, 11:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0036: Dead Legends: A Weird West LARP; "Danger on the Dixie Queen" by Pertho Productions LLC. A high-stakes poker tournament is being held aboard the steamship "The Dixie Queen" attracting gamblers, scoundrels and spies from across the divided American continent. Card-sharps of all stripes have gathered the $1000 entry fee, with the hopes of winning the $100,000 dollar jackpot! But all is not as it seems as many of the passengers have their own secret agendas! Players will take the roles of gamblers, swindlers, entertainers, crewmen and spies all vying to complete their secret objective before the Dixie Queen makes landing in St. Louis. Dead Legends is a Weird West Nerf and Boffer adventure-horror game set in an alternate history America. Character archetypes will be Pregenerated. Western Lite Costuming encouraged. Saturday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0037: "A Ring Fit for a Queen" by Xanodria Productions Inc.. You find yourself in the Last Chance Tavern. Secluded from the world by the mother of all storms. All you have is your wits, your sword and a lot of unanswered questions. Xanodria Productions offers you this adventure in medieval fantasy. The game will offer boffer combat with elements of magic. Weapons and characters will be provided. Xanodria Productions Inc. is a LARP company that runs out of the Hamburg Pennsylvania area. Saturday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance. See Also: L0047.

L0038: Knight Realms; "Tower of the Arcane Sons". Hidden among the mountains is a tower devoted to the cult who serves the first necromancer, Necrophitus Arcane. To strike a sure a blow against the villain's army, you heroes have been called to action! Venture into the tower and defeat the monsters that lie within, and help put a stop to the necromancer's nefarious plans! Saturday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, All Ages.

L0039: The Dresden Files Fate LARP Rules; "Holy Orders" by Phoenix Outlaw Productions. On the hunt for one of the final keys to a magical gateway that can save the world, the supernatural community of New York undertakes a daring heist. Join us as they delve into the lair of one of the most dangerous organizations in the magical world for a caper and confrontation with a truly unholy foe. Come join us for "Holy Orders", the DEXCON 20 episode of the ongoing Dresden Files Empire State Chronicle presented by Phoenix Outlaw Productions. Returning players are welcome, while new players may either receive pre-created characters or contact staff at dresdenfileslarpny@gmail.com to make characters before the event. Costuming is encouraged; bring your Dresden best. Saturday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0040: Werewolf: The Apocalypse; "Rage Against the Cage" by By Night Studios; presented by Robert Recckia & Colin Cherry. Gaia depends on the Garou as her immune system, to provide her support and protection from harm. In turn, it is the Kinfolk that provides those very same services that keep the Garou in the fight... and when Kinfolk begin to go absent and fail to perform those tasks, it is not only the Garou, but Gaia herself that suffers. But in this time when Helios is high above and the summer is in its strength, the Sept of the Dark Soil has put out the call to attend the seasonal Rite of the Great Hunt. It is this call that brings you here... Join the Central New Jersey Domain of the Mind's Eye Society for "Rage Against the Cage". Make your own character by contacting the Storyteller at ApocVST.MESPrinceton@gmail.com by 6/30/17. Pre-generated characters will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. For more information, please visit us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/MESPrinceton/. Saturday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0041: Bulldogs! LARP; "Trouble on Job Tower" by Galileo Games. Travel the star-lanes in a sci-fi LARP that kicks ass! Whether you are a bounty hunter, spy, criminal, or just someone down on their luck, everyone comes through Job Tower, the best place to find anyone or any job in the galaxy. This is a high-action, high fun LARP set in the universe of the Bulldogs! tabletop RPG. You can take a role as a gambler, a hit man, a bounty hunter, a bodyguard, a space pirate, and much more! Contact us before the game for info on characters, and visit the wiki for lore on the world: http://bulldogs-rpg.wikia.com/wiki/Bulldogs!_RPG_Wiki Saturday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0042: Cthulhu Live! 3.5; "Flies in Amber" by PST Productions. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! In a spirit of cooperation, the Federation and the Klingon Empire have come to an agreement to share resources along the Neutral Zone. One of these places is a small class M planet simply known as NZ0002. The planet is rich in dilithium ore. While excavating a rich vein, a Federation mining company found something buried in a rock face. This object of unknown origin was reported to Starfleet. The Federation has dispatched an Oberth Class Science Vessel, The USS Archimedes to investigate. Not to be outdone, the Klingon Empire has also sent out a "science" vessel to make sure any information gleamed from this strange object is shared. "Flies In Amber' is a Cthulhu Live! / Star Trek crossover LARP set in the 23rd century. This is the Original Series timeline. Players will take up the roles of Miners, Members of the crew of The Archimedes, and loyal servants of the Klingon Empire. There are several alien races to choose from and costumes are encouraged. This is a DEXCON 20 exclusive event. Character are pre-assigned. For character info and assignment please contact us at pstproductions@gmail.com. Saturday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0043: Quantum Vortex; "Issue #2-2: Aliens in Space" by Green Dragon Studios. The last year has seen the superheroes of the Star League go up against giant robots, the Red Bratva, evil cultists, and even a dragon! Now you deserve a little R & R. Dr. Alexander White has arranged a tour of the new space factory and attendance to the gala ball celebrating the production of the new Grav IV space fighter. What could possibly go wrong! Characters are provided or contact us in advance to make a custom character: Quantum Vortex LARP on Facebook or quantumvortexlarp@gmail.com. Saturday, 8:00PM - 4:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance.

L0044: The Nexus; "Founder's Day" by Double Exposure, Inc.. One year ago, in a place called The Nexus, a town called INDEX was compiled. Today, a seeming "Founder's Day Festival" has bubbled up around the town, celebrating that beginning. But entropy and dissipation are eating away at the edges of our new civilization. Can we fix it in time for Pie? Saturday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

L0045: Vampire: The Masquerade; "Capital City: Masquerade" by By Night Studios; presented by Robert Recckia & Colin Cherry. In a World of Darkness, where vampire masters pull the puppet strings of mortal society, a Kindred's politics can draw blood just as readily as his fangs. At the intersection of establishment, anarchy and independence, opportunity arises in the form of a secret negotiation between those that do not wish their blood to be shed. Representatives from the Camarilla Domain of Trenton, the Anarch Barony of Princeton and the Independent Alliance holdings of West Windsor have agreed to come together to discuss the establishment of 'outposts', or embassies, within each other's claim sovereignty. Yet as surely as there are voices that would gain from keeping peace between these competing sects, there are equally those that benefit from the conflict and who would seek to disrupt these talks. And what of those that claim allegiance not to any sect, but solely to extra-planar entities? Will rumors and accusations of recent infernal activities drive these potential partners closer together or push them further apart? Join the Central New Jersey Domain of the Mind's Eye Society for "Capital City: Masquerade". Make your own character by contacting the Storyteller at CAVST.MESPrinceton@gmail.com by 7/1/17. Pre-generated characters will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. For more information, please visit us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/MESPrinceton. Saturday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0046: "Sleep: The LARP" presented by Andrew Sirkin. A DEXCON 20 EXCLUSIVE! "Extremely realistic!" "Very well run!" "An incredible LARP experience!" The reviews are in from last year and this year we're introducing some new mechanics: Triple Pillows! As the energy surge from Chocolate Heaven wears off and the magnitude of DEXCON 20 settles firmly in your bones, you will begin to drift towards your hotel room for the ultimate LARP. Complete rules will be taught in your first dream. Good night. Saturday, 12:00AM - 8:00AM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

L0047: "A Ring Fit for a Queen". See L0037. Sunday, 10:00AM - 2:00PM; One Round.

L0048: New World Magischola; "A Wolf By Any Other Name" by Learn Larp, LLC. See L0011. Sunday, 10:00AM - 2:00PM; One Round. See Also: L0021.

L0049: Planebreak: Novica; "Preludes" by Edge of Forever LLC. Still reeling from a devastating economic crash, the Novan Dominion is nonetheless committed to fostering the spirit of intrepid expansion and exploration that has always defined it. To that end, the Dominion is embarking on an unprecedented project - establishing a joint colony with the newly-independent Skybound nation. But given the dangerous nature of the mission, prisoners from both nations have been offered freedom if they agree to take part. The expedition is not solely made up of prisoners - there are many pioneering citizens who have volunteered as well, seeking fame, fortune, or a new life. The caravan has gathered and is prepared to move out. With two nations at a tenuous peace and wagons full of criminals, what can possibly go wrong? Sunday, 10:00AM - 2:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Serious, 18 & Over ONLY.

G0050: GREYHAWK REBORN; "How to Train your Kobold (and Other Enlightened Humanoids)" by Dave Siroonian & William Guardino. GHR-KEO17-07: The Theocracy of Ravonnar needs your help training a new colorful group of adventurers but is the Sheldomar Valley ready? A Universal Social Module for PC's Levels 4-16. Wednesday, 10:00PM - 2:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0059, G0080, G0106, G0117, G0130.

G0051: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Punchline" by Matthew Dunn & Sam Tagliaferre. GHR-GEO17-03: The gnomes of the Stark Mounds are used to not being taken seriously, but events take a turn with a visit from one of the Breninís chancellors during a cultural festival. A one round universal adventure set in the Stark Mounds during CY 617 for levels 1-4. Wednesday, 10:00PM - 2:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0052: GREYHAWK REBORN; "The Monster" by William Guardino. GHR-GHBN-0666: An 'evergreen' introduction to the Greyhawk by Night campaign. Adventurers learn about the evil within and the consequences of difficult decision. A four-hour urban investigative adventure for first level characters set in the Iuz Territories. Wednesday, 10:00PM - 2:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, Under 18 Requires Parental Clearance. See Also: G0107.

G0053: LEGENDS OF THE SHINING JEWEL; "Under the Streets". LSJ6: After Amthydor's recent invasion of undead, many parts of the city suffered great damage. Amthydor needs her wrecked sewers restored. The Lord Monarch has ordered the system to be repaired... but the workers who are trying to do so keep turning up dead. Can you get to the bottom of what lurks under the streets of the Shining Jewel? This event is two rounds in length and is for heroes of levels 1-6. LSJ is a Pathfinder compatible system. Thursday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0054: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Hell's Rebels: In Hell's Bright Shadow" by Crystal Frasier. PFS-MOD 01: The rebellion begins! The city of Kintargo has long been a safe haven for artists, freethinkers, and those marginalized by the oppressive Chelish government, but now the city has been placed under martial law by inquisitor BarzillaiThrune. When a protest turns into a riot, a new group of heroes comes together to form an organized resistance against the devil-binding government and the church of Asmodeus - but can they survive long enough to establish allies? Or will they become the latest victims of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune? From the Adventure Path Hell's Rebels. This is a two-round adventure for Character Levels 2-4. Thursday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0055: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Midnight Mirror" by Sam Zeitlin. PFS-MOD 01: The sleepy town of Karpad in shadow-haunted Nidal has long been overseen by the Boroi family, and until a few weeks ago, the citizens under Baron StepanBoroi's rule have lived uneventful lives of relative peace. Recently, however, the outbreak of a virulent and fatal disease and a number of mysterious disappearances have left the people of Karpad paranoid and fearful. Even Baron Stepan has been acting strangely, and now the tenuous balance of racial tensions between Karpad's human and fetchling populations stands on the verge of collapsing into total anarchy. Can the PCs uncover the root of Karpad's problems and put an end to the deadly virus, the terrifying disappearances, and the miasma of fear and distrust that threatens to overwhelm the region? For characters level 3-5. Thursday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0056: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Refugees of the Weary Sky" by Jeffrey Swank. PFS 8-17: As the Jistka Imperium decayed from within, its artificers and elementalists struggled to repel invaders from Osirion to the east. To channel their elemental power, the spellcasters constructed the mighty Citadel of the Weary Sky, but so much energy attracted a mighty fiend that crushed the tower. The Pathfinder Society knows that many of the mages escaped, but only recently and with the help of a new ally did it learn where they fled. Now the PCs set off for a forgotten Jistkan sanctuary where otherworldly forces now reign. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7-11. Thursday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0057: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Serpents' Ire" by John Compton. PFS 7-98: A parasitic faction known as the Korholm Agenda has tried to corrupt the upstanding Aspis Consortium from the inside out, all in the vain pursuit of revenge and profit. Now one of the powerful Aspis Patrons has learned that the Korholm Agenda has siphoned the Consortium's funding to build a base of operations in Nidal. This shall not stand. He has assembled a team of top agents - including both new faces and veterans of the attack on the Grand Lodge a year ago - to infiltrate the operation and shut it down by any means necessary. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for 8th-level pregenerated characters. Thursday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0077, G0102, G0122.

G0058: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "To Seal the Shadow" by Jason Keeley. PFS 8-14: To most, Mount Shibotai's devastating eruption was a footnote in Tian history. To the shadow-bound wayangs who settled the jagged crater in Minata, the volcano was the reason they inhabited Golarion at all. In their de facto capitol Inahiyi, the wayangs host an annual festival to commemorate the catastrophe that brought them into this world and forced them to ally with their neighbors against a common threat. On especially auspicious anniversaries, the wayangs invite foreigners to contribute to the ceremony, and the Pathfinder Society has negotiated the privilege of having its agents observe the sacred ceremonies as these outside participants. This is no mere anthropological opportunity, though, and the PCs may be all that stands between their world and an unspeakable evil. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5. Thursday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0093.

G0059: GREYHAWK REBORN; "How to Train your Kobold (and Other Enlightened Humanoids) (GHR-KEO17-07)" by Dave Siroonian & William Guardino. See G0050. Thursday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round. See Also: G0080, G0106, G0117, G0130.

G0060: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Placid Island of Ignorance" by John Lent. GHR-GHBN17-04: Something fishy is going on in the village of Cei Connah. Will you be able to resist the sirens' call, or will you all be wet behind the ears when the morning sun rises? Part 1 of the Waiting Dreamer story arc. An eight hour Urban Social-Investigative adventure for 10th level characters set in the Iuz Territories. Thursday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0061: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "House of Harmonious Wisdom" by Katherine Cross, Sarah Hood, Jason Owen Black & Christopher Rowe. PFS 8-16: A series of five Quests designed for levels 1-5. Mighty Lung Wa once controlled much of Tian Xia, but the empire crumbled a century ago. Three Successor States have squabbled for dominance ever since, each insisting that it alone is the rightful inheritor of Lung Wa's glory. In the shadow of these mighty nations, the humble land of Shokuro has sought the means to discourage its neighbors' territorial ambitions and earn their respect. When a retired hero learns of a lost, legendary palace that might protect relics of the old empire, she calls on the Pathfinder Society for assistance finding the fabled site. The PCs must travel to each of the Successor States in search of clues to uncover the palace and the treasures within. House of Harmonious Wisdom includes five 1-hour adventures that take the PCs across central Tian Xia in search of imperial treasures and forgotten secrets. The series includes a beginning adventure and a finale, but players can experience the other parts in any order. Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0119.

G0062: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Through Maelstrom Rift" by Linda Zayas-Palmer. PFS 7-99: Even the limitless Plane of Air is at risk of eldritch instability, and a cult dedicated to the planes' integrity has sensed an imminent calamity brewing deep within a primal storm. In this special adventure, the players portray a diverse coalition of elemental guardians that must embark on perilous journey into the maelstrom's heart and avert a disaster that threatens the Inner Sphere. A Pathfinder Society Special designed for 6th-level pregenerated characters. Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Provided. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0086, G0111, G0129.

G0063: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Torrent's Last Will" by Cole Kronewitter. PFS 8-20: On the Plane of Water, familiar sights grow on impossible scales, from monumental swaths of kelp to utterly titanic sea creatures. The Society has traced a powerful relic to a tremendous shell adrift within a miles-wide swarm of giant jellyfish, and with the help of new allies, the PCs might recover it. They had best beware, though, for the Plane of Water is home to sahuagin and worse that are not eager to welcome intruders. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7-11. Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0112.

G0064: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Havoc in Highport" by Jay Stypinski. GHR-POM17-02: Having rescued the boys of Fallowfield from the Cult of the Earth Dragon, the signs point to the self-styled 'Slave Lords' having a base somewhere in Highport. Are you brave enough to challenge the slavers on their own turf, and perhaps find out more clues as to who is behind the raids? A four-hour Urban and Dungeon adventure for 5-10 level characters set in the Pomarj. Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0105, G0125.

G0065: SHADOWRUN MISSIONS; "Build A Runner Workshop/The First Taste" by Catalyst Game Labs. SRM07-00: So, you want to become a runner and learn about Shadowrun? This is the perfect event for you. Create your own Shadowrun 5th edition character play through a short encounter. Thursday, 2:00PM - 6:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0066: LEGENDS OF THE SHINING JEWEL; "Course Correction". LSJ205: The temples of Sorena and Destine have summoned you to meet with them regarding the location of the next piece of the object you seek. A one-round Legends of the Shining Jewel Adventure for ATLS 11-21. LSJ is a Pathfinder compatible system. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0067: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Champion's Chalice, Part 1: Blazing Dangerous Trails" by Benjamin Bruck. PFS 8-18: Every year, the Sargavan government hosts the Sargava Chalice, a contest of speed and survival that draws eager competitors from far and wide, each hoping to win fame, fortune, and glory. This year, Pathfinder Society has taken a special interest in the competition, sponsoring a team of agents to compete to with the trophy. Can PCs overcome their competition and the dangers of the Sargavan wilderness to emerge victorious? Blazing Dangerous Trails is the first scenario in the two-part "Champion's Chalice" campaign arc. It is followed by Pathfinder Society Scenario #8-21: Agents of the Eye. Both chapters are intended to be played in order. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0090.

G0068: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Champion's Chalice, Part 2: Agents of the Eye" by Nicholas Herold. PFS 8-21: Ages before the rise of modern civilization, the cyclops empire of Ghol-Gan ruled what is now the Mwangi Expanse. The Society sends the PCs deep into the untamed Kaava lands to explore a cyclops ruin, where with a new tool in hand, the Pathfinders might uncover its forgotten and dark history. Can the PCs prevent the ruin's past from becoming Sargava's future? Agents of the Eye is the second scenario in the two-part "Champion's Chalice" campaign arc. It is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #8-18: Blazing Dangerous Trails. Both chapters are intended to be played in order. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0109.

G0069: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Phantom Phenomena" by Brian Duckwitz, Cole Kronewitter & Nicholas Milasich. PFS Q-1: A series of six Quests designed for 1st-level characters. Bizarre phenomena have tormented the people of southeastern Ustalav for decades, and these events become stronger and more dangerous every year. Hoping to uncover the origins of these flashes of red lightning and spectral hauntings, Dr. Quolorum from the Sincomakti School of Sciences has set out with a team of able-bodied assistants. Can the PCs help the professor unlock the secret that dwells above Lantern Lake? Phantom Phenomena includes six, 1-hour adventures that take the PCs to a superstitious village, a lightning-scarred woodland, an ancient Kellid monolith, a haunted manor, an occult university, and finally into the storm-choked mountains. Experience the adventures in any order to create a unique story. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0070: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Rise of the Goblin Guild (Blast From the Past Event)" by Matthew Goodall. PFS 4-01: When a monster is discovered on the grounds of the Pathfinder Lodge at Heidmarch Manor in Magnimar, an investigation into its appearance leads the PCs deep under the City of Monuments - and face to face with a burgeoning thieves' guild. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0071: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Fools Rush In" by Jay Stypinski. GHR-KEO17-06: You have been asked by the Baroness of Shelspring to venture into the Rushmoors on a mission of some urgency and delicacy. But will you end up as victims rather than victors? A one-round stand-alone Wilderness adventure for 1st to 4th level characters set in the Shelspring Barony and Rushmoors in Keoland. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0079, G0116.

G0072: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Scarlet Surveillance" by John LeDonne. GHR-SEA17-03: The Island of Jetsom lies just 12 miles off the coast of Monmurg. The Council believes that it could serve as a staging point for another invasion by Scarlet Brotherhood forces. You've been asked to undertake reconnaissance of Jetsom Isle to see what assets the Brotherhood has there, and eliminate them if possible. Are you up to the task? A one-round stand-alone Dungeon adventure for 5th - 10th level characters set in the Hold of the Sea Princes. Thursday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0096, G0131.

G0073: LEGENDS OF THE SHINING JEWEL; "Traffic Stop" by Nancy Lee Clark. LSJ199: A new poison has infected the city of Amthydor and one section of the city is in dire need of your help. Can you stop the poison or at least keep it from spreading? This adventure is for characters who have reached level 9 or higher. LSJ is a Pathfinder compatible system. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; All Materials Offered. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0074: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Dawn of the Scarlet Sun" by Sam Zeitlin. PFS-MOD 02: The coastal city of Magnimar is no stranger to crime, yet recently, a series of murders has sent a chill through the early morning streets. Someone - or something - is stalking and killing worshipers of Sarenrae, the goddess of the sun. The city guard is prepared to ambush the murderer, but they need help - help of the kind that adventurers are so good at providing. What is the sinister truth behind these violent acts? For characters level 4-6. Friday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0075: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Hell's Rebels: Turn of the Torrent" by Mike Shel. PFS-MOD 02: The rebel group known as the Silver Ravens once fought for independence in the city of Kintargo, but after the Chelish Civil War came to an end, they disbanded - until today! Now, new heroes have reestablished the organization to stand against the inquisitor BarzillaiThrune and his oppressive diabolic regime. But before the Silver Ravens can rise up, they need allies - friends among powerful groups like the Order of the Torrent Hellknights, a hidden cult of Milani, and disenfranchised agents of the government itself. But until the heroes find the ideal hideout for their rebellion - a place secret enough and strong enough to withstand the battles to come - they'll be forced to stay in the shadows. When a perfect site for their headquarters comes along, will the heroes survive long enough to claim it as their own? From the Adventure Path Hell's Rebels. This is a two-round adventure for Character Levels 5-7. Friday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0076: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "In Wrath's Shadow (Blast From the Past Event)" by Mike Shel. PFS 4-02: In the ruins of Xin-Bakrakhan - seat of power of the Runelord of Wrath - the Pathfinder Society stands on the verge of a great discovery, but first the brave agents exploring the ruins must survive ages-old dangers and contemporary threats to return with the knowledge and wealth they've unearthed. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0077: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Serpents' Ire (PFS 7-98)" by John Compton. See G0057. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round. See Also: G0102, G0122.

G0078: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Treacherous Waves" by Eleanor Ferron. PFS 8-19: The Society believes that a powerful relic lies in the depths of the Plane of Water, yet the most recent expedition to retrieve it failed for mysteriously tragic reasons. It's up to the PCs to travel to the aquatic metropolis of Vialesk to investigate that ill-fated mission and overcome the forces determined to keep the truth from coming to light.finder Society Scenario #8-21: Agents of the Eye. Both chapters are intended to be played in order. A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3-7. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0104.

G0079: GREYHAWK REBORN; "Fools Rush In (GHR-KEO17-06)" by Jay Stypinski. See G0071. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round. See Also: G0116.

G0080: GREYHAWK REBORN; "How to Train your Kobold (and Other Enlightened Humanoids) (GHR-KEO17-07)" by Dave Siroonian & William Guardino. See G0050. Friday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round. See Also: G0059, G0106, G0117, G0130.

G0081: GREYHAWK REBORN; "In the Midst of Black Seas of Infinity" by John Lent. GHR-GHBN17-05: A sage and sailor of some repute needs your assistance with some wet work. He is more than happy to give you a share of the treasures you will uncover together, a rising tide lifts all ships as they say. A two-round dungeon delve set in the Iuz Territories for level 11 characters. Part 2 of the Waiting Dreamer story arc. Friday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0082: SHADOWRUN MISSIONS; "Company Man Run Out The Guns" by Catalyst Game Labs. G0091: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Honor's Echo" by Eleanor Ferron, Jenny Jarzabski & Landon Winkler. PFS Q-2: A series of six Quests designed for 1st-level characters. The grand Taldan Empire once controlled half of Avistan, but during the Even-Tongued Conquest, it could not manage an ongoing war with both its neighbor Qadira and the secessionist rebels in its outer provinces. As Taldor struggled to control its crumbling territories, its monarchs sought scapegoats for its failures, including the righteous war hero Countess HonariaAlcasti. Stripped of its nobility, her family has survived in obscurity for seven hundred years. However, her descendant Remaio has identified evidence that might redeem the Alcasti name and his ancestor's honor. Can the PCs help exonerate her name and bring glory to Taldor once more? "Honor's Echo" includes six, 1-hour adventures that take the PCs from the verdant wilds of Andoran to the arid wastes of Qadira to the cultural heart of Taldor itself. Experience the adventures in any order to create a unique story. Friday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages.

G0092: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "The Cultist's Kiss (Blast From the Past Event)" by Sam Zeitlin. PFS 4-08: An active cell of the cult of Lissala - ancient goddess of runes and obedience - has been discovered in the Varisian town of Palin's Cove. Seeking a chance to learn about this long-lost faith not from millennia-old relics but from its current practice, a team of Pathfinders travels to the industrial seaside settlement to uncover the secret coven and infiltrate its services in the guise of prospective converts. Will the Pathfinders discover the knowledge they seek, or will the evil cult subvert them with its vile and seductive faith? A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7–11. Friday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0093: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "To Seal the Shadow (PFS 8-14)" by Jason Keeley. See G0058. Friday, 8:00PM - 12:00AM; One Round.

PFS 8-22: When members of the Shoanti Axe Clan saw fire shooting up into the sky over Varisia'sCaliphak Mountains, they rushed to investigate. They found a pair of doors inscribed with runes from ancient Thassilon, along with clear signs that the doors had recently been opened. In recognition of the Axe Clan's expanding alliances, the Shoanti offered both the Society and a priest of Soralyon from Riddleport the opportunity to explore the ruin and neutralize its dangers. Now that the priest has vanished within the complex, the PCs must uncover the ruin's history before the Shoanti lose faith in them and take matters into their own hands. For Levels 3-7. G0099: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Graves of Crystalmaw Pass" by Kalervo Oikarinen. PFS 8-23: One of Master of Spells SorrinaWestyr's former adventuring companions vanished to the Plane of Earth and was presumed dead. She has recently resurfaced along an old road between the Plane of Earth and the Plane of Fire - one that even the warring forces of the planes' greatest cities had abandoned - and has shown little interest in discussing her circumstances with the Pathfinder Society. Can the PCs uncover why she disappeared and enlist her help in reaching a site on the war-torn and volcanic borderlands? For Levels 1-5. Saturday, 9:00AM - 1:00PM; One Round; Bring Your Own Materials. Beginners Welcome; Fun, All Ages. See Also: G0127.

G0100: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Hell's Rebels: Dance of the Damned" by Richard Pett. PFS-MOD 03: You are Cordially Invited! Having successfully established a hideout in the city of Kintargo, the heroes of the growing rebellion are poised to take back the city. But before the Silver Ravens can strike against diabolic House Thrune, they must forge alliances with nearby tribes of aquatic elves and the free city of Vyre to cut off Cheliax's easy sea and land routes, forcing Lord-Mayor BarzillaiThrune to rely solely on his resources at hand to defend his control of Kintargo. Yet nothing is as simple as it seems, and the dangers awaiting the rebels are not always those that can be defeated with a spell or a sword. And, of course, BarzillaiThrune won't take these new developments lying down - what retribution might one of Cheliax's most dangerous inquisitors have in store for the Silver Ravens? From the Adventure Path Hell's Rebels. This is a two-round adventure for Character Levels 8-10. Saturday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

G0101: PATHFINDER SOCIETY; "Realm of the Fellnight Queen" by Sam Zeitlin. PFS-MOD 03: Stay Out of the Woods! Deep in the forest, something is stirring. An evil fey sorcerer, cast out of the First World millennia ago by her own kin, has found a way to break through the ancient walls of her prison, and carries with her a vengeance too deep to be sated. For the quiet Andoren town of Bellis, busy celebrating a long-awaited marriage, it's a time for joy and laughter. Yet the forest that's always sheltered it is growing dark, and things are moving in the heart of the woods... Realm of the Fellnight Queen is a wilderness adventure for 7th-level chararacters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest RPG. Inside you'll find a possessed druid, a drunken treant, an insane beekeeper, shape-changing forest warriors, and the dark mistress of the Fellnight Realm herself. For characters level 6-8. Saturday, 9:00AM - 6:00PM; Two Continuous Rounds; Bring Your Own Materials. Knowledge Necessary; Fun, All Ages.

R0186: Fantasy AGE (Dragon Age Magic); "Blood in the Great Thaig" by Green Ronin Publishing; presented by John Gallo. An Envoy Event! King Endrin Aeducan has just been formally declared dead, and the two candidates for the throne, Prince Bhelen Aeducan and Lord Pyral Harrowmont vie for power, while the other noble houses wheel and deal, using the power of their Assembly votes for leverage and each hoping to end up supporting the new seated King under Stone. In such times as these, opportunities abound for those with the right training and the right allies to make themselves a fortune, a reputation, or both. Will your future hum like lyrium in the Stone? Pregenerated characters provided. Using Fantasy Age ruleset but modifying the magic system to more closely resemble how magic works in the Dragon Age RPG and games. World Wide Wrestling is a pro wrestling RPG based on the Apocalypse World engine, featuring: Rich characters built on iconic wrestling archetypes, player decisions with real consequences that shape the unfolding storylines and feuds, and exciting narrative action, both in and out of the ring. R0203: D&D 5E; "Red Dragon of the North" presented by Ben Forest. Ben Forest presents his one-of-kind eight-hour extravaganza game; an all new adventure for DEXCON 20. The funder of the famed Adventuring Company - Bloomfield's Heroes - has gone missing. He was last known to be going to the remote and legendary mountains of the High Forest 2 years ago. Perhaps defeated by the Great Worm (Dragon Klouth) of the North himself? The party is closing-in. New and returning members of the "Bloomfield's Heroes" adventuring company are welcome. Join the "(Young) Bloomfield's Heroes" adventuring company; new members are always welcome. Adventures are based out of city-state of Silverymoon in the D&D Forgotten Realms North setting with some modifications. Challenges for players may include: monsters, foul-conditions, love, politics, treachery, friends and rivals, a war. As with all Bloomfield's Heroes adventures; outcomes and events can be unique; more like a home game. Pre-made characters are available or you're welcome to create your own; for guidelines for building your 13th level party member please email me at: benforest1@gmail.com. We will take a one-hour lunch break. Please note, this is a friendly game that takes the better part of a day; there is role playing and action with the core objective being fun for everyone. Please do not sign up if you're (1) only interest is battles, (2) do not enjoy team play or (3) have been up all-night. Small computers and tablets are welcome for use with the game; bring a 5th Edition Player's Handbook, real dice and a character printout if you create your own. R0228: Aurora; "What Do You Believe?" presented by Sam Hotchkiss. In this world, humans are not the dominant species. That title goes to Spirits, which are immortal, unyielding embodiments of belief. These Spirits gain magical powers and an animal-like form by aligning themselves with one of eight Aspects, natural forces with rigid belief systems. Humans live in isolated settlements and eke out an existence by appeasing and avoiding Spirits. You are a Shiny. Though you are born to a human mother, you are not human. And though you can draw on the power of the Aspects, you are not a Spirit. When you are just a child, a Spirit will come to your settlement to claim you. This Spirit will try to convince you to devote yourself to its Aspect, and if you do, you will become a Spirit yourself. Becoming a Spirit, however, robs you of your free will: every action you take will be dictated by your Aspect's moral code. Aurora is a game about discovering what you believe. Your beliefs, and how you choose to act on them, determines your access to magic, how the game punishes and rewards you, and ultimately, your fate. This is a playtest of a new RPG system. Temporary memory enhancement nano is one of the largest consumer products of the 21st Century. Obviously ancient Mesopotamian herdsmen shouldn't have it in their bodies. Let alone be able to manipulate people's behavior at vast distances of time. Your task is to span down to their era and untangle this paradox before you fall under their "spell". Don't presume easy superiority: Those herdsman know how to herd. Called "unusual" by the Sci-Fi Channel, and "unique and painfully satisfying" and "very cool" by player-reviewers on Amazon.com, CONTINUUM has broken new ground by logically solving every time travel conundrum, and actually made a civilization of time travelers outrageously playable. Make a good enough impression, and the doors will start opening for you. And so here you are, in a small backwood villa owned by a baron from Altdorf who uses it as a combination of a hunting lodge and an estate to go 'slumming it' with fawning sycophants.
